column5: Go to canada June 1 every year. Always come home with very cracked painfull lips. I keep them well coated with Chap-Stick sun screen 30. I read in newspaper to use a lip blam with a moisterizer, so I purchased some Banana Boat with Aloe Vera...but have my doubts. HELP.

Well, whatever you do, dont do what my brother did. He went into town to get me some hand cream for my cracked hands, and a bottle of Canadian whisky for himself. He saw a Hustler magazine on the shelf and grabbed that too. The lady behind the counter asked if he was going to have a party by himself! <{{}}><

I always get the dry hands and lips up north too. Likely form being outdoors and covered in fish slime. Use a moisturizing product since Chap Stick is just a wax protector and does nothing to rehydrate.
nutregena works for me manitoba .... a 100,000 lakes how many walleyes ???? i will never have enough time....
there is an old farm remody that may work. spred a little fresh cow manure on your lips. It doesn't help the capped problem, it just keeps you from licking em.
I've been using Avon Moisture Therapy Lip Balm for years. It works great. And you can usually get them on sale for less than $1.00.

Natural Ice Original lip protectant. It is hard to find but it is the best stuff. Go on Drugstore.com and buy it there. I ski, which is about as bad as it gets for your face and this is the best. My hands usually take the worst beating on a fishing trip and crack up bad. Gramma had an old remedy that my wife thinks is kinda "Brokeback", but it works. Cover your hands with vasaline or neosporin ointment, and then put socks on your hands and go to bed. The next morning, your hands are no longer cracked.
